alert.note: Alert for Hunterdon; Morris; Warren (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 14 at 3:28PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Morris, northern Hunterdon and central Warren Counties through 400 PM EDT... At 328 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Pleasant Valley, or 10 miles east of Easton, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Hackettstown, Washington, Netcong, Belvidere, Harmony, Oxford, Glen Gardner, Chester, Hampton, Califon, Bloomsbury, Great Meadows-Vienna, Brass Castle, Allamuchy-Panther Valley, Pleasant Valley, Long Valley, Roxburg, Budd Lake, Beatyestown and Beattyestown. This includes the following highways... Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 6 and 8. Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 18 and 23, and near mile marker 26. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
